DataElement.preferredName: Biologically-Derived Material Product Material Name Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A substance made from living organisms or things they produce. EXAMPLE(S): virus, therapeutic serum, toxin, antitoxin, vaccine, blood, blood component or derivative, allergenic product, analogous product A coded value specifying the non-unique textual identifier for the material. EXAMPLE(S): aspirin, tobacco, caffeine. NOTE(S): The granularity of the code may vary depending on the specificity of the material. For example, acetaminophen, Tylenol, Tylenol 250 mg gel cap.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biologically-Derived Material Product Material Name Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Natural substances derived from living organisms such as cells, tissues, proteins, and DNA.:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object._The words or language units by which a thing is known.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.
